Class Category

java.lang.Object
com.jeopardy.model.Category
public class Category extends Object
Represents a single Jeopardy category containing a set of questions.

Questions in a category are keyed by their point value and are expected to all share the same category name.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Category(String name)
    Creates a new category with the given name and an initially empty set of questions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Category

      public Category(String name)
      Creates a new category with the given name and an initially empty set of questions.
      Parameters:
      name - the display name of the category

  • Method Details

    • addQuestion

      public void addQuestion(Question question)
      Adds a question to this category.

      The question's category name must match this category's name; otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      question - the question to add
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the question's category name does not match this category's name

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of this category.
      Returns:
      the category name

    • getQuestion

      public Map<Integer,Question> getQuestion()
      Returns a copy of the map of questions in this category, keyed by their point value.

      The returned map is a defensive copy; modifying it does not affect the internal state of this category.

      Returns:
      a new Map containing all questions in this category

    • getQuestions

      public Question getQuestions(int value)
      Returns the question associated with the given point value, or null if no such question exists.
      Parameters:
      value - the point value of the question to retrieve
      Returns:
      the Question with the given value, or null if none exists

    • hasQuestion

      public boolean hasQuestion(int value)
      Determines whether this category contains a question with the specified point value.
      Parameters:
      value - the point value to check
      Returns:
      true if a question with the given value exists; false otherwise

    • getAllQuestions

      public Collection<Question> getAllQuestions()
      Returns a view of all questions in this category.

      The returned collection is backed by the internal map, so updates to the map are reflected in the collection.

      Returns:
      a collection of all Question objects in this category

    • allQuestionsAnswered

      public boolean allQuestionsAnswered()
      Checks whether all questions in this category have been answered.
      Returns:
      true if every question is marked as answered; false otherwise

    • getAvailableQuestionCount

      public int getAvailableQuestionCount()
      Returns the number of unanswered questions in this category.
      Returns:
      the count of questions that are not yet answered

    • hasAvailableQuestions

      public boolean hasAvailableQuestions()
      Determines whether there is at least one unanswered question in this category.
      Returns:
      true if any question remains unanswered; false otherwise

    • resetAllQuestions

      public void resetAllQuestions()
      Resets the answered state of all questions in this category so that they are all marked as unanswered.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this category, including its name and the number of questions it contains.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string describing this category
